title: Can a perma ban be lifted
body: Hello, today I was playing a normal games on league and when we started losing I was the one to be blamed, it started out them blaming me and I just started joking around, I knew the person who started it which he reported me after the game, I was joking around and I thought they were too so I just started shit talking, I didn't say anything offensive and I don't have the chat log because after I was the perma ban I started swearing because I've spent over 200 dollars on this game and someone disconnected the internet so I have to use my phone, you one see one side of the story which is my chat log, but I was wondering if I can contact riot to get my account back , and is there anyway to do it? I've been playing this game for around 4 years and spent over 200 dollars, I know I was shit talking but I don't want everything I have done and worked for to go to waste, I was want another chance I know I probably don't deserve it but I need this... Just tell me I I can email someone...

replies.body: perma ban is for repeated offender. Your story reeks of lies.
ive had one 14 day ban then it was a perma, they told me that they skipped the chat bans

You can attempt to appeal the ban by submitting a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They will take you through the process and determine whether the ban was rightful or a false positive. The ban will only be revoked if it is determined to be a false positive. Keep in mind, the punishment systems are based *solely* on your behaviour, not that of other players, so using excuses such as "they started it" (this is probably the most common excuse) will certainly not fly here.

Should the ban not be revoked and you wish to continue playing, there is nothing stopping you from making another account. Keep in mind, however, that repeating the same behaviour on another account is a good way to get that one banned as well, so it may pay to reflect on what has lead you to this point (even if you choose to switch to another game, really, as they'll likely be using fairly similar criteria).
You can't get 200 dollars and over 1000 hours back by making another account, but thanks.
